page.title: 03Farming around Milnathort
page.content: The agricultural land is used for general arable farming with some live- stock. Lowland grazing is secondary to the much larger acreage devoted to barley, potatoes, oil-seed rape, hay and silage, oats, some greens and some soft fruit. Three of the four farms in this block keep livestock. Kinross Home Farm has about 250 domestic stock; there are about 230 on Lethangie and on Orwell a similar number. Most of these are sheep, but Orwell has a milking herd of about 70 Friesian cattle. The sheep breeds are Border Leicester, some Blackface and some Suffolk. A few Jacob's sheep are also kept. Local potato contractors hire fields for their own use. Potato planting and harvesting creates seasonal work for many Milnathort people.
